validation.validators module

module:

src.validation.validators

synopsis:

Regex-based validators and simple normalization helpers.

This module centralizes basic input validation (email, IDs, names, etc.) and provides tiny normalization functions used across the School Management System.

Notes

  • Regexes are intentionally conservative to keep the lab predictable.

  • Normalizers aim for “reasonable” cleanup (case/spacing), not perfect i18n.

validation.validators.is_non_empty_string(v: Any) → bool[source]

Check that v is a non-empty (non-whitespace-only) string.

Parameters:

v (Any) – Value to check.

Returns:

True if v is a non-empty string, else False.

Return type:

bool

validation.validators.is_non_negative_int(v: Any) → bool[source]

Return True if v can be cast to int and is >= 0.

Parameters:

v (Any) – Value to check.

Returns:

True for non-negative integers (after casting), else False.

Return type:

bool

validation.validators.is_valid_course_id(v: Any) → bool[source]

Validate a course ID (e.g., EECE435 or EECE435L).

Parameters:

v (Any) – Value to check.

Returns:

True if matches COURSE_ID_RE, else False.

Return type:

bool

validation.validators.is_valid_course_name(v: Any) → bool[source]

Validate a course name for basic characters/length.

Parameters:

v (Any) – Value to check.

Returns:

True if matches COURSE_NAME_RE, else False.

Return type:

bool

validation.validators.is_valid_email(v: Any) → bool[source]

Validate email using a simple regex (not RFC-perfect, but fine for lab).

Parameters:

v (Any) – Value to check.

Returns:

True if v matches EMAIL_RE, else False.

Return type:

bool

validation.validators.is_valid_instructor_id(v: Any) → bool[source]

Validate an instructor ID using INSTRUCTOR_ID_RE.

Parameters:

v (Any) – Value to check.

Returns:

True if matches the expected pattern, else False.

Return type:

bool

validation.validators.is_valid_person_name(v: Any) → bool[source]

Validate a person’s name against PERSON_NAME_RE.

Parameters:

v (Any) – Value to check.

Returns:

True if name matches allowed pattern, else False.

Return type:

bool

Notes

  • This is pretty opinionated and not globally inclusive; okay for the lab.

validation.validators.is_valid_student_id(v: Any) → bool[source]

Validate a student ID using STUDENT_ID_RE.

Parameters:

v (Any) – Value to check.

Returns:

True if matches the expected pattern, else False.

Return type:

bool

validation.validators.norm_email(s: str) → str[source]

Normalize email by trimming and lowercasing.

Parameters:

s (str) – Email string.

Returns:

Normalized email (lowercase).

Return type:

str

validation.validators.norm_id(s: str) → str[source]

Normalize an ID by trimming and uppercasing.

Parameters:

s (str) – Identifier string.

Returns:

Normalized ID (uppercase).

Return type:

str

validation.validators.norm_name(s: str) → str[source]

Normalize a name with title-case and single spaces.

Parameters:

s (str) – Name string.

Returns:

Normalized name (title-cased, internal whitespace squashed).

Return type:

str

Notes

  • This will “pretty up” names like "  aLiCe   o'connor  " → "Alice O'Connor".
